did.unittitle: Wagner Free Institute of Science microscope and film slides

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of microscope slides. The bulk of the collection is mineralogical thin sections, although there are several boxes of biological and botanical slides. Many of the slides seem to have been mounted in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. Some of the slides appear to have come from commercial purveyors. The collection also includes two boxes of film slides: one of various diamond specimens, and one of a Philadelphia Mineralogical Society function, Harry Trudell, Edgar T. Wherry, and others.
